availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Lynn (Hopkins County,KY, carpenter and pvt 17th ky cav.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Emeline J. Baldwin Lynn in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1846. Father of Theodore M. Lynn, Hiram Lynn, and William A. Lynn. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Carpenter in Madisonville in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private. Died of measles while in service on January 8, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 53A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 836-37.
Case Files of Approved Pension Applications of Widows and Other Dependents of Civil War Veterans, ca. 1861- ca. 1910, NARA RG 15, Application# WC113134.
